head.title: Wall Street Remains on a Fed Alert

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Wall Street Remains on a Fed Alert

abstract.p: Week's stock market performance is mixed as investors await Federal Reserve decision on interest rates; graphs of stocks in news; tables (S)

block.p: A dash of positive economic news and strong quarterly earnings helped pull some stocks out of the dumps, but most investors remain fixated on the Federal Reserve.
A dash of positive economic news and strong quarterly earnings helped pull some stocks out of the dumps, but most investors remain fixated on the Federal Reserve.
We had a nice rally at the end of the week, but the volume has been very light, said Barry Berman, head trader for Robert W. Baird & Company in Milwaukee. The market is really on a Fed watch.

Fed policy makers are expected to raise short-term interest rates by as much as half a percentage point when they meet on Tuesday. The central bank is concerned that the economy is growing too rapidly and that inflation will heat up.

But economic data released last week gave some indication that the economy is slowing. The government reported that wholesale prices showed a 0.3 percent decline in April, reversing two months of increases, and that retail sales slowed in the same month.
Blue-chip stocks posted gains, and many companies reported solid earnings, including Dell Computer.
The Dow Jones industrial average ended the week at 10,609.37, up 31.51 points. The Nasdaq composite index settled at 3,529.06, down 287.76
